description: A medium-sized version of the Greater Sulphur-Crested, with the same white body and yellow crest, but noticeably smaller.
temperament: Shares the high intelligence and playful nature of its larger cousin but in a more compact package. Can still be very demanding and nippy.
loudness: Very Loud. Their screech is high-pitched and just as ear-splitting as the larger Sulphur-Crested cockatoos.
vocalization: Can learn to talk and mimic, but are primarily known for their loud natural calls.
dietaryNeeds: A low-fat pelleted diet is important. Supplement with a variety of vegetables. Use seeds and nuts only for training treats.
healthPointers: Can live for 40-50 years. Prone to the same issues as other Sulphur-Crested 'toos: feather plucking, PBFD, and obesity. They also produce a lot of dander.
housing: Not suitable for apartments. Requires a strong and secure cage with plenty of toys. Minimum size: 30"W x 24"D x 48"H.
